topicSummary: Gastroenteritis is a transient disorder due to enteric infection with viruses, bacteria, or protozoa.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Prescribing information for quinolones updated in line with MHRA, 2019, Fluoroquinolone antibiotics: new restrictions and precautions for use due to very rare reports of disabling and potentially long-lasting or irreversible side effects MHRA, 2019.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Aortic aneurysm and dissection is now listed as an adverse effect of ciprofloxacin.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Adverse effects updated within prescribing information - metronidazole.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: SPC update on quinolones to align all CKS topics prescribing advice. Prostatitis – chronic, Gonorrhoea, Pyelonephritis, Diarrhoea – prevention and advice for travellers, Dyspepsia – unidentified cause, Dyspepsia – proven functional, Dyspepsia – proven peptic ulcer, Diverticular disease, Gastroenteritis and Scrotal swellings.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Adverse effects of loperamide have been updated to include information in a U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) Drug safety communication, warning that exceeding the maxium dose can cause serious cardiac problems including QT interval prolongation, Torsades de Pointes or other ventricular arrhythmias, syncope, and cardiac arrest FDA, 2016.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Information on the concurrent use of clarithromycin or erythromycin with statins has been clarified.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in July 2014 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key RCTs published since the last revision of the topic. No major changes to clinical recommendations have been made. However, some sections have been reworded for clarity, and overview sections have been added in each scenario.
